1.name: Mary Poppins
1.description: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

2.name: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
2.description: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

3.name: Goldfinger
3.description: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.

4.name: A Fistful of Dollars
4.description: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

5.name: My Fair Lady
5.description: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can make a flower girl presentable in high society.

6.name: Marnie
6.description: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

7.name: The Umbrellas of Cherbourg
7.description: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.

8.name: Zulu
8.description: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

9.name: A Hard Day's Night
9.description: Over two "typical" days in the life of The Beatles, the boys struggle to keep themselves and Paul McCartney's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live television performance.

10.name: Cheyenne Autumn
10.description: The Cheyenne, tired of broken U.S. government promises, head for their ancestral lands but a sympathetic cavalry officer is tasked to bring them back to their reservation.

11.name: Woman in the Dunes
11.description: An entomologist on vacation is trapped by local villagers into living with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.

12.name: The Fall of the Roman Empire
12.description: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis, in which the deceased emperor's son, Commodus, demonstrates that he is unwilling to let anything undermine his claim to the Roman Empire.

13.name: A Shot in the Dark
13.description: Inspector Jacques Clouseau investigates the murder of Mr. Benjamin Ballon's driver at a country estate.

14.name: The 7th Dawn
14.description: Political and personal intrigues surround a group of characters in Malaya, after the close of the Second World War.

15.name: The Killers
15.description: Surprised that their contract victim didn't try to run away from them, two professional hit men try to find out who hired them and why.

16.name: Zorba the Greek
16.description: An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

17.name: The Night of the Iguana
17.description: A defrocked Episcopal clergyman leads a bus-load of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with the failure haunting his life.

18.name: Father Goose
18.description: During World War II, a man persuaded to live on an isolated island and spot aircraft finds himself responsible for a teacher and several students, all female.

19.name: The Naked Kiss
19.description: Kelly, a prostitute, traumatised by an experience, referred to as 'The Naked Kiss,' by psychiatrists, leaves her past, and finds solace in the town of Grantville. She meets Griff, the ...                See full summary »

20.name: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
20.description: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness after the arrival of a lost relative.

21.name: Blood and Black Lace
21.description: A masked, shadowy killer brutally murders the models of a scandalous fashion house in Rome.

22.name: Goodbye Charlie
22.description: Shot by a jealous husband, Charley falls out a porthole and is lost at sea only to find himself returned as an attractive blond woman. His best friend is staying at his house as he puts ...                See full summary »

23.name: The Gospel According to St. Matthew
23.description: The life of Jesus Christ according to the Gospel of Matthew. Pasolini shows Christ as a Marxist avant-la-lettre and therefore uses half of the text of Matthew.

24.name: Seven Days in May
24.description: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

25.name: Fail-Safe
25.description: American planes are sent to deliver a nuclear attack on Moscow, but it's a mistake due to an electrical malfunction. Can all-out war be averted?

26.name: Red Desert
26.description: In an industrial area, Giuliana, an unstable woman, attempts to cope with life by starting an affair with a co-worker at the plant her husband manages.

27.name: The Last Man on Earth
27.description: When a disease turns all of humanity into the living dead, the last man on earth becomes a reluctant vampire hunter.

28.name: The Train
28.description: In 1944, a German colonel loads a train with French art treasures to send to Germany. The Resistance must stop it without damaging the cargo.

29.name: The Soft Skin
29.description: Pierre Lachenay is a well-known publisher and lecturer, married with Franca and father of Sabine, around 10. He meets an air hostess, Nicole. They start a love affair, which Pierre is hiding, but he cannot stand staying away from her.

30.name: Murder Most Foul
30.description: When Miss Marple joins a theatrical company after a blackmailer is murdered, several members of the troupe are also dispatched by this mysterious killer.

31.name: What a Way to Go!
31.description: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely because of their drive to be rich.

32.name: Becket
32.description: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

33.name: Onibaba
33.description: Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask.

34.name: Seance on a Wet Afternoon
34.description: A medium and her husband stage a kidnapping in order for her to pretend to solve the crime and achieve fame.

35.name: The Bargee
35.description: Hemel Pike is a canal barge casanova, aided and abetted by his illiterate cousin, Ronnie. Hemel has a girl in every town along his route, and each one is intent on marriage. He is finally ...                See full summary »

36.name: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
36.description: A poor, uneducated mountain girl leaves her cabin in search of respect, a wealthy husband, and a better life in this fictionalized biopic of Margaret "Molly" Brown, who survived the 1912 sinking of the RMS Titanic.

37.name: Kwaidan
37.description: A collection of four Japanese folk tales with supernatural themes.

38.name: The Incredible Mr. Limpet
38.description: Meek and mild mannered bookkeeper Henry Limpet has few passions in life. It's mid-1941 and he would love to join the Navy but has been rated 4F. His friend George Stickle is in the Navy and...                See full summary »

39.name: 633 Squadron
39.description: An RAF squadron is assigned to knock out a German rocket fuel factory in Norway. The factory supplies fuel for the Nazi effort to launch rockets on England during D-Day.

40.name: Band of Outsiders
40.description: Two crooks with a fondness for old Hollywood B-movies convince a languages student to help them commit a robbery.

41.name: Viva Las Vegas
41.description: Race car driver Lucky Jackson goes to Las Vegas to earn money to pay for a new engine for his motor car. Working as a waiter, he still finds the time to court young Rusty Martin.

42.name: The Masque of the Red Death
42.description: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

43.name: Carry On Cleo
43.description: Two Britons are captured and enslaved by invading Romans and taken to Rome. Hengist Pod creates useless inventions, while Horsa is a brave and cunning fighter. One of their first encounters...                See full summary »

44.name: Paris When It Sizzles
44.description: The sprightly young assistant of a Hollywood screenwriter helps him over his writer's block by acting out his fantasies of possible plots.

45.name: Send Me No Flowers
45.description: A hypochondriac believes he is dying and makes plans for his wife which she discovers and misunderstands.

46.name: Bedtime Story
46.description: Two scam artists prey on women for their money. They clash in a Mediterranean hot spot. Will the cultured, high-class con artist come out on top, or will the rough small-change scammer rise to win the wager?

47.name: The Pawnbroker
47.description: A Jewish pawnbroker, victim of Nazi persecution, loses all faith in his fellow man until he realizes too late the tragedy of his actions.

48.name: The Moon-Spinners
48.description: Travelling through Crete to collect folk songs for the BBC, a British teen and her aunt stumble upon local criminals who are peddling gems stolen from a London bank.

49.name: Marriage Italian Style
49.description: The rich man Domenico and Filumena, a penniless prostitute, share great part of their lives in the immediate post WWII Italy.

50.name: Lilith
50.description: A war veteran gets work at a mental institution where he meets the beautiful, but eccentric, Lilith.
